Text: Steve Coopers Voice Mailpst As promised in last weeks meeting attached is the transcript of Steves voice mail Hope you all have a wonderful week Call me or email if you need anything Thanks KB
Steve Coopers Voice Mail pst Good Morning All Yesterday Steve Cooper sent out another voice mail Attached is the transcript Please let me know if you need anything Thanks KB

Vacation Policy Informationpst EA Estate Group Please see the below reference of Enrons vacation eligibility allowance and scheduling policy Vacation Eligibility All regular fulltime employees are eligible for vacation based on continuous service Regular parttime employees receive hours per year of paid vacation per year Temporary employees are not eligible for vacation Vacation Allowance Vacation allowance is based on an employees continuous service according to the following schedule Employees must be on the payroll and actively at work as of the first business day of the calendar month to accrue vacation for that month If the first day of the month falls on a holiday or weekend causing the employee to have a hire date other than the first the vacation accrual date will be dated the first of the month so that the employee will accrue vacation for the month For example an employee with a hire date of January will have a vacation accrual date of January The intent of this change is only to affect the vacation accrual date as explained it is not to affect any other term condition privilege or benefit of employment Length of Continuous ServiceVacation Allowed From hire date to the end of the calendar year in which the employee was hired Prorated accrual of hours per month for each full calendar month completed For an employee hired in a prior calendar year who has less than years of service weeks hours per year For an employee with at least but less than years of service weeks hours per year For an employee with at least years of service weeks hours per year Vacation may be taken any time in the calendar year in which the employee will complete required service for weeks weeks or weeks of vacation per the schedule above except for the hire year Vacation Scheduling and Approval Supervisors The supervisor will develop a vacation schedule that ensures all essential operations are maintained effectively All vacation requests are subject to Supervisor approval Tthe Estate will continue to implement its current policy with respect to the payment of unused vacation under most circumstances Any questions regarding this policy should be addressed to Khymberly Booth X Thanks ENA Human Resources

Netco employeespst I have just received confirmation for the employees who will be going over to Netco Netco transfers Chuanli Deng Nelson Neale Martin Lin Jason Solok and Thomas Barkley will be released with most of your group on KB

FW FYIpst Please see below and make sure to communicate to Jason that he will be released on with the others Please get back to me regarding Martin KB Original Message From Zarkowsky Sarah Sent Friday January AM To Booth Khymberly Subject RE FYI Thanks Spoke with David Port NO to Jason Sokolove decided not to bring him on to Netco
Release Datespst Please review and verify the attached spreadsheet lining out the releases in your group KB

PRC Tips Cc TIPS EGM Management Below is a list of Tips for the MidYear PRC Process Each tip refers to information that we have received many questions about and would like to clear up any confusion We will be meeting with each of you individually before the final meetings to ensure that we have captured accurate information on all your employees for the meetings Please contact me if you need further information X Exempt vs NonExempt Employees All exempt employees who were hired prior to Jan will be represented in a PRC meeting and will be ranked those hired after Jan will receive feedback only Employees who transferred after will be reviewed by their previous Business Unit Nonexempt employees will receive feedback only they will not be rated in a meeting only those up for promotion will be discussed At year end they will be ranked in categories only Preferred Distribution The preferred distribution is as follows Category Category Category Category Category Descriptors vs Ratings Descriptors highly effective effective etc are used on employee feedback forms only and reveal how the employee performs in a skill area ie communication teamwork etc The ratings refer to how the employee ranks next to his peers There are categories of performance ratings relative to peers the employee is generally among the top of his peers relative to peers the employee is generally between of his peers relative to peers the employee is generally between of his peers relative to peers the employee is generally between of his peers relative to peers the employee is generally among the bottom of his peers

PRC Tips Cc TIPS EGM Management Below is a list of Tips for the MidYear PRC Process Each tip refers to information that we have received many questions about and would like to clear up any confusion We will be meeting with each of you individually before the final meetings to ensure that we have captured accurate information on all your employees for the meetings Please contact me if you need further information X Exempt vs NonExempt Employees All exempt employees who were hired prior to Jan will be represented in a PRC meeting and will be ranked those hired after Jan will receive feedback only Employees who transferred after will be reviewed by their previous Business Unit Nonexempt employees will receive feedback only they will not be rated in a meeting only those up for promotion will be discussed At year end they will be ranked in categories only Preferred Distribution The preferred distribution is as follows Category Category Category Category Category Descriptors vs Ratings Descriptors highly effective effective etc are used on employee feedback forms only and reveal how the employee performs in a skill area ie communication teamwork etc The ratings refer to how the employee ranks next to his peers There are categories of performance ratings relative to peers the employee is generally among the top of his peers relative to peers the employee is generally between of his peers relative to peers the employee is generally between of his peers relative to peers the employee is generally between of his peers relative to peers the employee is generally among the bottom of his peers

Vacation Policy Informationpst EA Estate Group Please see the below reference of Enrons vacation eligibility allowance and scheduling policy Vacation Eligibility All regular fulltime employees are eligible for vacation based on continuous service Regular parttime employees receive hours per year of paid vacation per year Temporary employees are not eligible for vacation Vacation Allowance Vacation allowance is based on an employees continuous service according to the following schedule Employees must be on the payroll and actively at work as of the first business day of the calendar month to accrue vacation for that month If the first day of the month falls on a holiday or weekend causing the employee to have a hire date other than the first the vacation accrual date will be dated the first of the month so that the employee will accrue vacation for the month For example an employee with a hire date of January will have a vacation accrual date of January The intent of this change is only to affect the vacation accrual date as explained it is not to affect any other term condition privilege or benefit of employment Length of Continuous ServiceVacation Allowed From hire date to the end of the calendar year in which the employee was hired Prorated accrual of hours per month for each full calendar month completed For an employee hired in a prior calendar year who has less than years of service weeks hours per year For an employee with at least but less than years of service weeks hours per year For an employee with at least years of service weeks hours per year Vacation may be taken any time in the calendar year in which the employee will complete required service for weeks weeks or weeks of vacation per the schedule above except for the hire year Vacation Scheduling and Approval Supervisors The supervisor will develop a vacation schedule that ensures all essential operations are maintained effectively All vacation requests are subject to Supervisor approval Tthe Estate will continue to implement its current policy with respect to the payment of unused vacation under most circumstances Any questions regarding this policy should be addressed to Khymberly Booth X Thanks ENA Human Resources
